title: Type Tool Question
content:
Hello,  
I have a question about the following picture.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001342im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pic1.jpg)
  
From time to time I like to open up exisiting fonts  
in Type Tool to see how they work. I recentley opened up  
Helvetica Regular and noticed that on the C they have  
these guidelines, in Tpye Tool it is located on the Vector  
control layer, that follow the curve. When I erase the  
guidlines it then erases the section of the font.  
What are these lines for and how do you use them?  
Thanks!

j o s e p h

 [‹ What has been changed in Fontographer 4.7.3?](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001342/http:/typophile.com/node/18964 "Go to previous forum topic") [Opentype PS vs Opentype TT ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070809001342/http:/typophile.com/node/18821 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Joseph

comments.content: Joseph, you’re looking at a glyph defined with TrueType outlines.
